item.title: Why Diversity Programs Fail
item.description:
Why Diversity Programs Fail

Idea in Brief The Problem To reduce bias and increase diversity, organizations are relying on the same programs they've been using since the 1960s. Some of these efforts make matters worse, not better. The Reason Most diversity programs focus on controlling managers' behavior, and as studies show, that approach tends to activate bias rather than quash it.

item.title: Beyond the Holacracy Hype
item.description:
Beyond the Holacracy Hype

Idea in Brief The Hype Holacracy and other forms of self-organization have been getting a lot of press. Proponents hail them as "flat" environments that foster flexibility, engagement, productivity, and efficiency. Critics say they're naive, unrealistic experiments. The Reality Neither view is quite right.

item.title: A Message to Garcia
item.description:
A Message to Garcia

By Elbert Hubbard (1899) Note: "A Message to Garcia" is a classic essay about initiative published by Elbert Hubbard in 1899 in The Philistine. The essay created such a sensation that Hubbard republished it as a booklet with additional background and commentary. The text of that booklet appears below.

item.title: Disney Institute
item.description:
Disney Institute

Disney Institute is the professional development arm of The Walt Disney Company. Built on the global success of Disney, our solutions engage organizations in time-tested best practices, sound methodologies, and real life business lessons that facilitate corporate culture change.

item.title: Bill Torbert
item.description:
Bill Torbert

Action Inquiry & Global Leadership Profile Workshops In this blog entry and newsletter, I want to bring your attention to some potent new tools for practicing the exercise of mutual power. Mutual Power The theory and practice of Collaborative Developmental Action Inquiry claims, illustrates, and presents research data that support the notion that mutual power is more powerful than unilateral power.

item.title: Speed of Trust Transformation Process™ | Leadership Training and Organizational Culture Change | FranklinCovey
item.description:
Speed of Trust Transformation Process™ | Leadership Training and Organizational Culture Change | FranklinCovey

Watch 3 short videos as Stephen explains how trust drives employee engagement, enables success in the midst of change, and is the greatest leverage for executing your top priorities. Engagement Change Multiplier Watch several clients discuss their experience and results achieved with theSpeed of Trust Transformation Process™.
